intro: Sphacele lindeniana, commonly known as the Lindenberg's sphacele, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
